meanings.definition: Pertaining to or characteristic of atheism.
meanings.sent1: Her atheistic views led her to question the existence of any higher power.
meanings.sent2: The professor's atheistic perspective influenced his interpretation of the world.
meanings.sent3: Despite his atheistic tendencies, he still enjoyed attending the church choir performances.
meanings.sent4: The atheistic atmosphere in the room was palpable as the debate on religion heated up.
meanings.sent5: The atheistic philosophy was like a shield against any form of religious influence.

meanings.definition: Holding the belief that there is no God.
meanings.sent1: The atheistic group organized events to discuss their shared disbelief in a higher power.
meanings.sent2: She had an atheistic upbringing, which shaped her worldview from a young age.
meanings.sent3: The atheistic cat refused to enter the church, as if sensing a divine presence.
meanings.sent4: His atheistic stance was as firm as a mountain, unwavering in the face of religious arguments.
meanings.sent5: The atheistic conviction burned brightly within him, guiding his every decision.
